text: hi everyone its Helen here recently I
received so many requests for vegetarian
dishes as you might not have know in
Vietnam 85 percent of the people are
practicing Buddhist some of them are
full-time vegetarians but many of them
eat vegetarian
two times per month that is on the first
and the fifteenth day after month in
lunar calendar but nowadays many people
prefer vegetarian cuisine and not only
for religious reasons but also for the
actual reasons in Vietnam vegetarians
cooks are very creative and they can
turn almost any non vegetarian dish into
your vegetarian today I will be cooking
one of those dishes
it's called avid no GL or braised duck
in fermented tofu and of course we're
not using duck but substitute for duck
let's begin for this recipe I'm gonna
use two cans of vegetarian Mok knock
your local Asian grocery store I should
have them it is made of wheat gluten so
this is a vegetarian but not a gluten
free recipe it's high in protein and has
a distinctive artificial flavor and
texture of duck I was really impressed
when I opened the can it looks so like a
real piece of duck
doesn't it look Addison has goose bumps
he just slice it into half-inch pieces
like this another main ingredient is of
course fermented tofu we cut it Dow is

you should be able to fight it at Asian
store this is like the Asian version of
stinky cheese so don't be shocked
because of the smell in a small bowl mix
three to four cubes of fermented tofu
with a teaspoon or two of sugar a

optional Ming's garlic and ginger
about a teaspoon each and about a
tablespoon of the juice from the maca
can mix well
and mash the fermented tofu to turn it

then come by this mixture with the mock
duck also add some pepper and mix well
set aside for about fifteen to thirty
minutes
so the mocked-up can have time to absorb
all these flavors next cut our rolls
into one to one and a half inch cubes
you can fried it to your garden brow or
just leave it other days
next cut about three inch of leek or
Peru in thin strips then chop finely now

the fermented tofu might smell quite

fiber rings of the mock duck m√§kinen

national sweetness to the stew also
pouring the remaining liquids from the
cans you can also add water or vegetable

it boys lower the heat and cover the lid
cook under medium-low heat for about 15

soft have a taste and adjust the
seasonings I added about TSP more salt
to serve later over rice noodles or
pasta the sauce is very flavorful
garnish with some chopped leek and your
inner is ready
another popular
way to serve this dish is under the form
of hotpot just place the pot in the

love this sauce basically I have a
fermented tofu ginger a little bit of

trust your taste because not all

saltiness to serve you just add the
greens into the hot pot let the pot boil
to cook the vegetables and summarize
vermicelli to your bowl and enjoy the
